bio:treatment.discussion: The Asian (Korean) species Clematis serratifolia Rehder, with light yellow sepals and purple stamens, may also escape from cultivation and spread locally.

references.reference: Essig, F. B. 1990. The Clematis virginiana (Ranunculaceae) complex in the southeastern United States. Sida 14: 49-68. Grey-Wilson, C. 1989. Clematis orientalis (Ranunculaceae) and its allies. Kew Bull. 44: 33-60.
Hara, H. 1975. The identity of Clematis terniflora DC. J. Jap. Bot. 50: 155-158.
